item.title: ICC Champions Trophy 2025: Bangladesh suffer fresh blow after Shakib Al Hasan fails 2nd bowling action test in Chennai - Mint
item.description:
ICC Champions Trophy 2025: Bangladesh suffer fresh blow after Shakib Al Hasan fails 2nd bowling action test in Chennai

Publication Date: January 2025 | Source: Live Mint

Bangladesh and their star all-rounder Shakib Al Hasan faced another setback for the upcoming ICC Champions Trophy 2025 as Shakib failed his second bowling action test in Chennai. He will be able to play as a batsman but remains suspended from bowling.

  • Shakib was first reported for a suspect bowling action during a match in September.
  • He failed his first test in the UK at Loughborough University on December 15, 2024.
  • The Sri Ramachandra Centre for Sports Science in Chennai confirmed the failure of the second assessment.
  • Captain Najmul Hossain Shanto and BCB president Faruque Ahmed support Shakib's inclusion in the squad.
  • Bangladesh's Champions Trophy campaign begins against India on February 20, requiring squad announcements by January 12.
“A successful reassessment is required for the bowling suspension to be lifted.” - BCB statement

This news adds to the challenges for Bangladesh as they prepare for a crucial tournament, with Shakib's experience being vital despite his ongoing suspension.

item.title: Aussie pacer faces extended absence after shoulder surgery decision - ICC Cricket
item.description:
Aussie Pacer Faces Extended Absence After Shoulder Surgery Decision

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

Australian cricketer Richardson has announced his decision to undergo shoulder surgery to enhance stability and minimize injury risks. This decision will prevent him from completing the season with the Scorchers but is aimed at ensuring a stronger return for the future.

  • Richardson cites limitations due to shoulder issues over the past few years.
  • The surgery aims to improve his performance and decrease the likelihood of future injuries.
  • He acknowledges the difficulty of missing the rest of the season but believes it is necessary for his long-term career.
  • The timing of the surgery is planned to optimize recovery before next summer's Shield cricket.
“While it's a tough call, especially as it means I won't be able to finish the season with the Scorchers, this is the best option to set me up for a strong and healthy return to cricket.”

Richardson expresses gratitude for the support he has received and looks forward to returning stronger for the summer of 2025/2026.

item.title: Reports: Virat Kohli's selection for England tour to depend on Shubman Gill - CricTracker
item.description:
Virat Kohli's Future Depends on Shubman Gill's Performance Ahead of England Tour

Publication Date: January 11, 2023 | Source: CricTracker

Ace India batter Virat Kohli is under increased scrutiny following modest performances in recent matches. His selection for the upcoming England tour will hinge on Shubman Gill's form.

  • Kohli managed only 190 runs in nine innings during the Border-Gavaskar Trophy.
  • The All India Men's Senior Selection Committee met to discuss the T20I squad and Kohli's future.
  • Shubman Gill's future performance will influence Kohli's potential place in the Test team.
  • The selectors plan to reassess the situation as the series against England approaches.
  • The 2025 Champions Trophy may be the last for Kohli and Rohit Sharma.
“Shubman Gill hasn’t settled into the Kohli role as he was expected to.” - Hindustan Times

The selectors' decisions regarding Kohli will be closely monitored as the team prepares for upcoming competitions.

item.title: Rohit Sharma Makes Captaincy Promise To BCCI In Meeting, Report Says He Will Quit After... - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Rohit Sharma's Future as Captain in Question Following BCCI Meeting

Publication Date: January 25, 2025 Source: NDTV

Indian cricket captain Rohit Sharma has discussed his future with the BCCI, indicating he may quit captaincy months ahead following recent defeats including a series loss to Australia.

  • Rohit spoke to BCCI officials, including chief selector Ajit Agarkar and coach Gautam Gambhir.
  • The team has faced disappointing results lately, leading to scrutiny of Rohit's captaincy.
  • He expressed a desire to continue as captain for a few more months while advising the BCCI to seek a successor.
  • Jasprit Bumrah's name emerged as a potential long-term captain despite doubts about his leadership capabilities.
  • Rohit aims to lead the team through the upcoming ICC Champions Trophy before examining his future further.
“I want to remain the team's captain for a few more months.” - Rohit Sharma

Rohit Sharma's imminent decisions bear significant weight on India's cricketing landscape, with potential leadership changes looming on the horizon.

item.title: Jasprit Bumrah in danger of missing entire Champions Trophy because of back injury - The Times of India
item.description:
Jasprit Bumrah Faces Potential Absence from Champions Trophy Due to Back Injury

Date: February 2024 | Source: Times of India

The Indian cricket team may face a significant challenge as their star fast bowler, Jasprit Bumrah, is at risk of missing the upcoming Champions Trophy due to a back injury.

  • Bumrah has been experiencing swelling on his back and will be monitored at the BCCI's Centre of Excellence in Bengaluru.
  • The national selectors are awaiting the full medical report before making a decision on Bumrah's selection for the Champions Trophy.
  • The deadline for announcing the squad is Sunday midnight, and it is unclear if Bumrah will be included.
  • In the recent Border-Gavaskar Trophy, Bumrah had an impressive performance but could not bowl on the final day due to the injury.
  • He recently returned from a long injury layoff after undergoing back surgery last year.
“The selectors are yet to get the entire medical report about Bumrah, but at the moment, things don’t look good for him.”

This situation raises concerns about India's bowling lineup as they prepare for a crucial tournament with some key players still recovering from injuries.

item.title: BBL 2024-2025: Match 32, REN vs STA Match Prediction – Who will win today’s BBL match between REN vs STA? - CricTracker
item.description:
BBL 2024-2025: Match 32, REN vs STA Match Prediction

Date: January 12, 2025 Source: CricTracker

Melbourne Renegades (REN) face Melbourne Stars (STA) in Match 32 of the BBL 2024-25 at Docklands Stadium. REN is coming off a recent win, while STA seeks redemption after a shaky start to the season.

Key Points:

  • REN currently sits sixth in the points table with 3 wins and 4 losses.
  • STA is seventh, having won 3 of their 8 games.
  • The pitch is expected to favor batsmen with good bounce, suggesting the toss-winner will likely bowl first.
  • Recent matches have shown STA's resurgence with three consecutive victories.

Notable Statistics:

Melbourne Stars' skipper Marcus Stoinis has scored 246 runs this season, and Thomas Stewart Rogers is the second-leading wicket-taker with 13 wickets.

In conclusion, it is predicted that the team bowling first will have the advantage in this match.

item.title: ICC Champions Trophy 2025: New Zealand name uncapped Ben Sears, Mitchell Santner to lead Kiwis in his 1st major event - Mint
item.description:
ICC Champions Trophy 2025: New Zealand name uncapped Ben Sears, Mitchell Santner to lead Kiwis in his 1st major event

Publication Date: Sunday, Source: Live Mint

New Zealand has announced their 15-member squad for the upcoming ICC Champions Trophy 2025, featuring uncapped pacer Ben Sears and led by Mitchell Santner in his first major ICC event.

  • Ben Sears is included as an uncapped pacer in the squad.
  • Mitchell Santner will lead the team in his first major ICC tournament as the full-time captain.
  • The tournament is scheduled to take place in Pakistan starting February 19.
  • New Zealand will play a tri-series in Dubai against Pakistan and South Africa before the tournament.
  • Matt Henry will spearhead the bowling attack alongside Lockie Ferguson.
“It will also be O’Rourke and Smith's maiden senior ICC event.”

New Zealand will depart for Pakistan on February 3.

item.title: BCCI cracks whip regarding players not playing Ranji Trophy; Rohit and Virat's absence from domestic cricket discussed - Hindustan Times
item.description:
BCCI Enforces Domestic Cricket Participation Amid Rohit and Virat's Absence

Date: Jan 12, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

The BCCI has taken strict measures to ensure that all senior players participate in domestic cricket, particularly addressing the absence of Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli from the Ranji Trophy.

  • BCCI reviewed the performance of the senior men's team after disappointing results in recent tournaments.
  • Senior players are now required to participate in domestic matches unless they have a medical exemption.
  • Rohit Sharma last played in the Ranji Trophy in 2015, while Virat Kohli's last match was in 2012.
  • The next Test for India is against England in June 2025.
“A player will be granted exemption only when Gambhir and Agarkar cite workload-related issues.”

This decisive move by the BCCI aims to reinvigorate the domestic cricket scene and ensure that top players are participating at all levels.

item.title: 'Pressure is mounting': Dinesh Karthik on challenges for Gautam Gambhir as India head coach - The Times of India
item.description:
Dinesh Karthik Discusses Challenges for Gautam Gambhir as India's Head Coach

Publication Date: Unknown | Source: Unknown

In this article, Dinesh Karthik shares insights on the pressures and challenges that Gautam Gambhir will face as the head coach of the Indian cricket team, emphasizing the expectations and scrutiny that come with the role.

  • Karthik highlights the immediacy of the challenges facing Gambhir.
  • The article touches on the expectations from fans and the cricketing fraternity.
  • Insights into Gambhir's coaching style and potential strategies are discussed.
  • The need for a strong team environment is emphasized for success.
“Pressure is mounting for Gambhir as he steps into this crucial role.”

The article underscores the importance of leadership in cricket and how Gambhir's tenure as head coach could shape the future of the Indian cricket team.

item.title: Bitter Jasprit Bumrah Champions Trophy Blow To India, Report Says India Pacer To Miss... - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Bitter Jasprit Bumrah Champions Trophy Blow To India, Report Says India Pacer To Miss...

Date: January 12, 2025 Source: NDTV

The Indian cricket team is facing a setback as Jasprit Bumrah is unlikely to recover in time for the Champions Trophy due to worsening back spasms.

  • Bumrah experienced back spasms during the final Test against Australia.
  • His condition was found to be worse than anticipated, with swelling on his back.
  • He is currently undergoing rehabilitation at the National Cricket Academy (NCA) in Bengaluru.
  • BCCI has requested an extension for the squad announcement due to Bumrah's injury.
  • There is uncertainty whether to include him in the 15-man roster or as a reserve in the UAE.
"He (Bumrah) will be going to NCA for his rehabilitation. The initial report says he doesn't have a fracture but has swelling on his back."

The outcome of Bumrah's recovery is critical, as his absence could significantly affect India's performance in the Champions Trophy, with the semi-finals set to begin shortly after his expected rehabilitation period.

item.title: Rohit Sharma expected to take India future call at 'appropriate time'; Kohli's England tour fate depends on Shubman Gill - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Rohit Sharma expected to take India future call at 'appropriate time'; Kohli's England tour fate depends on Shubman Gill

Date: Jan 12, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

The future of Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma was a central topic during the recent BCCI review meeting, where their recent disappointing performances were scrutinized.

  • BCCI selection committee, led by Ajit Agarkar, discussed the future of Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli.
  • Rohit Sharma's recent Test performance has raised concerns; he scored only 164 runs in eight matches.
  • Kohli's future depends on Shubman Gill's performance before the England tour.
  • Kohli performed poorly during the Australia tour, managing only 90 runs besides one century.
  • The selectors have the option to reconsider positions based on upcoming performances.
“That is not to say that Rohit’s 'I am not going anywhere' statement is how things will ultimately transpire.”

The selectors will monitor performance closely as the next Test series approaches, looking for signs of form improvement from both senior players.

item.title: Shakib Al Hasan fails second test of bowling action - ESPNcricinfo
item.description:
Shakib Al Hasan Fails Second Bowling Action Test

Publication Date: January 7, 2024
Source: ESPNcricinfo

Shakib Al Hasan has failed a second test of his bowling action and remains suspended from bowling in cricket following assessments in Chennai and the UK.

  • Shakib's bowling suspension is still in place after failing a recent test.
  • He is eligible to play as a batsman in all formats of cricket.
  • The continued suspension may affect his selection for the upcoming Champions Trophy.
  • Shakib's last international appearances were in Tests against India in late 2024.
“A successful reassessment is required for the bowling suspension to be lifted,” stated the BCB.

The future of Shakib's role in the Bangladesh team hinges on the results of his bowling action reassessment.
